[b:992zng4a]Spondre[/b:992zng4a]
[b:992zng4a]Author:[/b:992zng4a] Jay Nabonne
[b:992zng4a]Link:[/b:992zng4a] [url:992zng4a]http://textadventures.co.uk/games/view/yy0qt1xtp0yrrn5tdvdtiq/spondre[/url:992zng4a]
Spondre was an amazing text adventure with a unique story.  It used some interesting mechanics as well that makes it a one of a kind.
[b:992zng4a]Score[/b:992zng4a]
[b:992zng4a]Gamepage:[/b:992zng4a] 9/10
It's definitely appealing and catches my eye.  I can't quit explain it but it feels like it's missing something.
***
[b:992zng4a]Gameplay[:/b] 17/20
It got somewhat repetitive after a while but other than that it was quit fun.
[b]Difficulty:[/b:992zng4a] 10/10
To trust or not to trust?  Perfect!  Isn't too easy but not quit too hard.
[b:992zng4a]Story:[/b:992zng4a] 19/20
Wonderful story but somewhat cliche.
[b:992zng4a]Mechanics:[/b:992zng4a] 18/20
I liked how you had the option to click on text to learn more but was somewhat confused as to how you knew what to click on...  Liked how there is alternative endings, definitely, a plus.
[b:992zng4a]Bugs:[/b:992zng4a] 10/10
No bugs or typos spotted.  You can beat this game.
[b:992zng4a]Bonus:[/b:992zng4a] 8/10
Overall Spondre is like a classic text adventure and I really enjoyed it.  Definitely recommended for you to try out! 
[b:992zng4a]Final Score:[/b:992zng4a] 91/100
[b:992zng4a]Grade[/b:992zng4a] A-
